org.latency4j.processing

Class AsynchronousLatencyMonitor

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.latency4j.processing.AsynchronousLatencyMonitor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    LatencyMonitor

    public class AsynchronousLatencyMonitor
extends java.lang.Object
implements LatencyMonitor

    The default latency monitor shipped with the Latency4J toolkit. As its name implies, it processes all durations , generated from monitored requirements, in an asynchronous fashion. Put differently, processing takes place outside the thread of execution. As such, it does not inadvertently skew the latency figures for monitored operations/tasks.

      • taskErrored

        public WorkDuration taskErrored(java.lang.Throwable cause)
        Description copied from interface: LatencyMonitor

        Invoked if the execution of a task is aborted due to an exception.

        Specified by:
        taskErrored in interface LatencyMonitor
        Parameters:
        cause - The error which caused processing to be aborted. Implementations should support null for this field.
        Returns:
        The duration of the task up until the point the error occurred. The returned instance will also contain details of the error that caused the task to fail.

      • createTaskEntry

        public void createTaskEntry(java.lang.String methodName)

        Creates an entry in the internal durationId-> WorkDuration duration map for the current execution point i.e. the current thread and method.

        Parameters:
        methodName - The name of the method for which the entry is to be created.
